intro: Conyza pterocaulon, commonly known as the hairyleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble clusters of small flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually hairy and oval-shaped, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Conyza pterocaulon is often found in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
